dmca.title: Notice of Copyright Infringement
dmca.body:
From: Paul Macnamara [mailto:paul.mac@rogers.com] 
Sent: Wednesday, August 03, 2005 9:52 AM
To: copyright@theplanet.com
Subject: Notice of Copyright Infringement
Importance: High

Dear Mr. Poletes ,

It has come to my attention that a site that resides on your servers is
displaying and offering for use web based software that is solely our
property. The site in question is http://www.pokerlogger.net/ .

This exact poker earnings tracking tool is our property and we must insist
that it be removed from the site in question. We believe that the code was
stolen when our site resided on www.pokerledger.com . This site now
redirects to our main poker portal at
http://www.winatpoker.com/article/introducing-pokerledger .

Here a some example urls that show that the code was clearly a copy of our
work.

1)Our Page
http://www.winatpoker.com/register.php

The stolen page
http://www.pokerlogger.net/register.php

2)Our page
http://www.winatpoker.com/viewusers.php

Stolen page
http://www.pokerlogger.net/users_list.php

3) our page
http://www.winatpoker.com/viewstat.php?id=382

Stolen page
http://www.pokerlogger.net/statistic.php?id=11

If you follow the following URL you will se that the owner of the site that
is using our software posts a request on a popular programming job board
requesting a tool like ours.
http://www.scriptlance.com/projects/1115806992.shtml

These are quotes taken from that page:

"I need someone to write a clone of http://www.pokerledger.com in either PHP
or Perl."

This is the response of the programmer:

"I can do the exact site copy for you in PHP/MySQL. Regards, Skiv :::"

As you can see, this was the chosen programmer and they did in fact write an
exact clone of our tracking software.

We has a good faith belief that use of the material in the manner complained
of is not authorized by the copyright owner, its agent, or the law.

information in this notification is accurate, and under penalty of perjury,
I, Paul Macnamara is authorized to act on behalf Net results Inc, owner of
the Poker Ledger software.

Thank you in advance for your quick attention to this matter.

Paul Macnamara
President Net Results Inc.
1754 Summerlands Cres
Orleans, Ontario
Canada K1E 2Y2
613-841-0491
 paul.mac@rogers.com
